Pigs / Farmers: The making of Truus en Connie 10/12
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Erik Lint (regie en productie)
Erik Lint (direction and production)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: UvA
documentaire
locatietheater
varkenspest
documentary
making of
theatre
Classical Swine Fever
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Varkens / Boeren: The making of Truus en ConnieÂ is een document dat laat zien hoe een gezelschap reageert op gebeurtenissen uit de werkelijkheid en het verhaal van de varkens en de varkensboeren gestalte geeftInÂ Varkens / Boeren: The making of Truus en ConnieÂ maakt Erik Lint van het repetitieproces van Truus en Connie de voorstelling, een documentaire (speelduur 46 min). We zien hoe theater op locatie wordt gemaakt. En we zien regisseur Johan Simons met zijn acteurs aan het werk: Chris Nietvelt en Elsie de Brauw die de boerinnen spelen, en Bram Coopmans en Linda Olthof als varkens. Truus en Connie Â maakte samen metÂ NageslachtÂ deel uit van een tweeluik over de varkensboeren, dat op locatie in de voormalige Verkadefabriek in Den Bosch werd gespeeld. Daarnaast werd een aantal besloten voorstellingen gegeven op boerderijen in Brabant, bij boeren thuis in de kamer, de stal of de schuur. Truus en Connie is gebaseerd op interviews die journalist Lex Bohlmeijer met Brabantse varkensboerinnen hield. De impact van de varkensepidemie van 1997 en de moeilijke keuze tussen doorgaan en stoppen voor boeren zijn de belangrijkste ingrediÃ«nten van de theatervoorstelling. Varkens / Boeren: The making of Truus en ConnieÂ is een document dat laat zien hoe een gezelschap reageert op gebeurtenissen uit de werkelijkheid en het verhaal van de varkens en de varkensboeren gestalte geeft.

PigsÂ / Farmers: The making of Truus en ConnieÂ is a documentary about theÂ rehearsal process ofÂ Truus en Connie, the performance.Â It shows how a theatre company deals withÂ reality and true dramaÂ and how it internalizes the story of pigs and farmers during the epidemic of Classical Swine Fever inÂ 1997 in the Netherlands

Daarnaast werd een aantal besloten voorstellingen gegeven op boerderijen in Brabant, bij boeren thuis in de kamer, de stal of de schuur.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Actors Pierre Bokma and Marieke Heebink portray the infamous Shakespearian couple that, driven by an insatiable lust for power, are prepared to go to the limit to fulfill their ambitions â€“ getting more and more blood on their handsPierre Bokma and Marieke Heebink portray the infamous Shakespearian couple that, driven by an insatiable lust for power, are prepared to go to the limit to fulfill their ambitions â€“ getting more and more blood on their hands. The actors give credit to the linear story (filled with supernatural elements) of the commander who, inspired by the prophecies of three witches (here played by male actors), aspires to become king. Bokma and Heebink show in their own way how evil slowly creeps into their minds and how they finally self-destruct out of madness and remorse. Paul Gallis designed the set with black walls before the intermission and red ones after it. In the middle of the stage stands a large bowl with clear water in which heads are cooled and hands are washed. In the end the water is blood red. The fantasy costumes were designed by Tessa Lute: austere long skirts and jackets, fanciful battle dresses and a lot of variations on Scottish chequered tartan.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Actors Pierre Bokma and Marieke Heebink portray the infamous Shakespearian couple that, driven by an insatiable lust for power, are prepared to go to the limit to fulfill their ambitions â€“ getting more and more blood on their handsPierre Bokma and Marieke Heebink portray the infamous Shakespearian couple that, driven by an insatiable lust for power, are prepared to go to the limit to fulfill their ambitions â€“ getting more and more blood on their hands. The actors give credit to the linear story (filled with supernatural elements) of the commander who, inspired by the prophecies of three witches (here played by male actors), aspires to become king. Bokma and Heebink show in their own way how evil slowly creeps into their minds and how they finally self-destruct out of madness and remorse. Paul Gallis designed the set with black walls before the intermission and red ones after it. In the middle of the stage stands a large bowl with clear water in which heads are cooled and hands are washed. In the end the water is blood red. The fantasy costumes were designed by Tessa Lute: austere long skirts and jackets, fanciful battle dresses and a lot of variations on Scottish chequered tartan.
oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: Muizelaar, Titus (uitvoerende: Duncan, koning van Schotland / Menteth / Moordenaar / Heks)

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: MacBeth 15/33
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Toneelgroep Amsterdam, Gerardjan Rijnders (regie) / Erik Lint (video)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: UvA
theater
Shakespeare
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Actors Pierre Bokma and Marieke Heebink portray the infamous Shakespearian couple that, driven by an insatiable lust for power, are prepared to go to the limit to fulfill their ambitions â€“ getting more and more blood on their handsPierre Bokma and Marieke Heebink portray the infamous Shakespearian couple that, driven by an insatiable lust for power, are prepared to go to the limit to fulfill their ambitions â€“ getting more and more blood on their hands. The actors give credit to the linear story (filled with supernatural elements) of the commander who, inspired by the prophecies of three witches (here played by male actors), aspires to become king. Bokma and Heebink show in their own way how evil slowly creeps into their minds and how they finally self-destruct out of madness and remorse. Paul Gallis designed the set with black walls before the intermission and red ones after it. In the middle of the stage stands a large bowl with clear water in which heads are cooled and hands are washed. In the end the water is blood red. The fantasy costumes were designed by Tessa Lute: austere long skirts and jackets, fanciful battle dresses and a lot of variations on Scottish chequered tartan.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Actors Pierre Bokma and Marieke Heebink portray the infamous Shakespearian couple that, driven by an insatiable lust for power, are prepared to go to the limit to fulfill their ambitions â€“ getting more and more blood on their handsPierre Bokma and Marieke Heebink portray the infamous Shakespearian couple that, driven by an insatiable lust for power, are prepared to go to the limit to fulfill their ambitions â€“ getting more and more blood on their hands. The actors give credit to the linear story (filled with supernatural elements) of the commander who, inspired by the prophecies of three witches (here played by male actors), aspires to become king. Bokma and Heebink show in their own way how evil slowly creeps into their minds and how they finally self-destruct out of madness and remorse. Paul Gallis designed the set with black walls before the intermission and red ones after it. In the middle of the stage stands a large bowl with clear water in which heads are cooled and hands are washed. In the end the water is blood red. The fantasy costumes were designed by Tessa Lute: austere long skirts and jackets, fanciful battle dresses and a lot of variations on Scottish chequered tartan.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Buff (Liefhebber), the theatre critic, comes home after another bad performance. Heâ€™s made up his mind. Heâ€™s never going to the theatre again and he doesnâ€™t want to write any more reviews either. Theatre no longer has any connection with reality, he says. Drama is everywhere, except on the stage. In a long monologue Buff vents his anger about contemporary theatre: a theatre of imitation that no longer has anything to do with real life.Buff (Liefhebber), the theatre critic, comes home after another bad performance. Heâ€™s made up his mind. Heâ€™s never going to the theatre again and he doesnâ€™t want to write any more reviews either. Theatre no longer has any connection with reality, he says. Drama is everywhere, except on the stage. In a long monologue Buff vents his anger about contemporary theatre: a theatre of imitation that no longer has anything to do with real life. His wife and his son Peter, who are also present in the living room, try to interrupt him, but to no avail. Buff continues to vent his anger. He hangs on to a reality that he has compiled from newspaper stories, snippets from the radio and television images. In the meantime, the drama of his wife and son is taking place right before his unseeing eyes. Finally he commits suicide by stuffing his mouth with wads of paper ripped from his fatherâ€™s notepad. Buff reacts to none of this. The drama of reality just passes him by. He has decided to call the editor-in-chief and offer him his resignation. The play ends at the moment Buff gets through to him on the phone. The play in fact is one long monologue, delivered by Buff. The mother only reacts with â€˜dadâ€™ or â€˜Peterâ€™ if one them says or does something out of order. Rijnders use of language is contemporary and aggressive, full of short, staccato-like sentences sometimes only consisting of a word or two. Liefhebber was first performed on 31 March 1992 by Toneelgroep Amsterdam under the direction of Gerardjan Rijnders.

His wife and his son Peter, who are also present in the living room, try to interrupt him, but to no avail. Buff continues to vent his anger. He hangs on to a reality that he has compiled from newspaper stories, snippets from the radio and television images. In the meantime, the drama of his wife and son is taking place right before his unseeing eyes. Finally he commits suicide by stuffing his mouth with wads of paper ripped from his fatherâ€™s notepad. Buff reacts to none of this. The drama of reality just passes him by. He has decided to call the editor-in-chief and offer him his resignation. The play ends at the moment Buff gets through to him on the phone. The play in fact is one long monologue, delivered by Buff. The mother only reacts with â€˜dadâ€™ or â€˜Peterâ€™ if one them says or does something out of order. Rijnders use of language is contemporary and aggressive, full of short, staccato-like sentences sometimes only consisting of a word or two. Liefhebber was first performed on 31 March 1992 by Toneelgroep Amsterdam under the direction of Gerardjan Rijnders.

boerenleven
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Het leven van een boeren vrouw die niet bij machte is het lot in eigen hand te nemen of te doorgronden. Uiteindelijk zetten haar frustraties en verdriet haar aan tot moord en ontvoering. Als een gekweld dier leeft ze toe naar haar einde. Yankeeweiland ( Amiwiesen) van Kerstin Specht werdÂ samen met De laars en de sok ( Der Stiefel und sein Socken) van Herbert AchternbuschÂ door Johan Simons geregisseerd in een tweeluik. Zij gingen op 16 maart 1995 op locatie inÂ de verlaten fabriek De Vrede in West-Knollendam in premiÃ¨re.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Double Points: Nero 5/7
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: ICK Amsterdam, Emio Greco | PC (regie en concept) / Erik Lint (video)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: UvA
moderne dans
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Double Points: Nero (2000) is een sleutelwerk in de overgang vanÂ de trilogieÂ Fra Cervello e Movimento naar Conjunto di NEROÂ and Rimasto OrfanoIn de trilogieÂ Fra Cervello e Movimento, die bestaat uit de werken Bianco (1996), Rosso (1997) en Extra Dry (1999), ontwikkeldeÂ Emio Greco and Pieter C. Scholten een geheel eigen methode en stijl in dans en inÂ scenografie: een zorgvuldig opgebouwd universum waarin dans ontstaat uit bewuste en onbewuste impulsen in het brein. Na de trilogie vervolgdeÂ Emio Greco and Pieter C. Scholten hun zoektocht viaÂ de â€˜etudesâ€™. In deze serie,Â deÂ â€˜Double Pointsâ€™ series, neemt Double Points: Nero (2000) een sleutelpositie in. Het werk kan beschouwd worden alsÂ eenÂ definitieve stap voortwaarts en een afscheid van de trilogie.Â Naast de solistÂ Greco verschijnen meer dansers op het podium. Double Points: Nero kan gezien worden als een sleutelwerkÂ in de overgang naar de ontwikkeling vanÂ werken voor meerdere dansers, Conjunto di NERO (2001) and Rimasto Orfano (2002).
oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: Greco, Emio (choreografie, regie, concept, muziek, vormgeving, licht, uitvoerende)
Scholten, Pieter C. (choreografie, regie, concept, muziek, vormgeving, licht)

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Fra Cevello e Movimento: Extra Dry 7/7
Fra Cevello e Movimento: Extra Dry 7/7
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: ICK Amsterdam, Emio Greco | PC (regie en concept) / Erik Lint (video)
ICK Amsterdam, Emio Greco | PC (direction and concept) / Erik Lint (video)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: UvA
moderne dans
contemporary dance
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Onderzoek naar de tweespalt tussen brein (cervello) en beweging (movimento); een ratio die verlangt naar controle over het lichaam, en het lichaam dat nieuwsgierig is naar nieuwe sensatiesFra Cervello e Movimento Fra Cervello e Movimento is een reeks van drie voorstellingen - Bianco, Rosso, Extra Dry - die het tweespalt brein (cervello) en beweging (movimento) onderzoekt; een ratio die verlangt naar controle over het lichaam, en het lichaam dat nieuwsgierig is naar nieuwe sensaties. Het motief is de interesse naar de reacties die innerlijke impulsen teweegbrengen in het lichaam. Extra Dry (1999) In Extra Dry betreedt voor het eerst een andere danser het universum van Emio Greco. De perfect beheersende ratio die het dansers lichaam de wil oplegt wordt geconfronteerd met weerstand van het lichaam om te gehoorzamen. Twee lichamen overtreden onzichtbare grenzen, bewegend van explosief tot exploratief, in een zoeken naar eenheid.

A dancer is joined by his double. His universe is invaded; the two bodies cross invisible boundaries, moving from the explosive to the exploratory in the search for onenessIn Extra Dry a dancer is joined by his double. His universe is invaded; the two bodies cross invisible boundaries, moving from the explosive to the exploratory in the search for oneness. The perfectly controlling mind, subjecting the body to the will of the dancer is confronted by the body's resistance to obey. Fra Cervello e Movimento Extra Dry is the third of a series called Fra Cervello e Movimento. Fra Cervello e Movimento is a set of three performances - Bianco, Rosso, Extra Dry that investigate the dyad brain (cervello) and movement (movimento); a mind that wishes to control and a body that is curious for new sensations. The motive is the interest towards the reactions that inner impulses impose on the body.

Het motief is de interesse naar de reacties die innerlijke impulsen teweegbrengen in het lichaam. Extra Dry (1999) In Extra Dry betreedt voor het eerst een andere danser het universum van Emio Greco. De perfect beheersende ratio die het dansers lichaam de wil oplegt wordt geconfronteerd met weerstand van het lichaam om te gehoorzamen. Twee lichamen overtreden onzichtbare grenzen, bewegend van explosief tot exploratief, in een zoeken naar eenheid.

A dancer is joined by his double. His universe is invaded; the two bodies cross invisible boundaries, moving from the explosive to the exploratory in the search for onenessIn Extra Dry a dancer is joined by his double. His universe is invaded; the two bodies cross invisible boundaries, moving from the explosive to the exploratory in the search for oneness. The perfectly controlling mind, subjecting the body to the will of the dancer is confronted by the body's resistance to obey. Fra Cervello e Movimento Extra Dry is the third of a series called Fra Cervello e Movimento. Fra Cervello e Movimento is a set of three performances - Bianco, Rosso, Extra Dry that investigate the dyad brain (cervello) and movement (movimento); a mind that wishes to control and a body that is curious for new sensations. The motive is the interest towards the reactions that inner impulses impose on the body.

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: UvA
moderne dans
contemporary dance
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Middels een e-mail correspondentie met de oostenrijkse auteur/criticus Helmut Ploebst, onderzoekt Bertha Bermudez Pascual haar verleden als klassiek balletdanseresMiddels een e-mail correspondentie met de oostenrijkse auteur/criticus Helmut Ploebst, onderzoekt Bertha Bermudez Pascual haar verleden als klassiek balletdanseres en haar ervaringen in het werken met William Forsythe en Emio Greco | PC. Ploebst en Bermudez Pascual ondervragen elkaar over de positie van de danser, choreograaf en toeschouwer en over het transitoire karakter van dans als zodanig: waar kan de dans rusten als de voorstelling is afgelopen? De voorstellingenreeks Double Points is voortgekomen uit een onderzoeksproces waarin de danser is blootgesteld aan impulsen van buitenaf, of aan een specifiek thema dat als uitgangspunt dient.

Through email correspondence with Austrian writer/critic Helmut Ploebst, Bertha Bermudez Pascual examines her past as a classical dancerThrough email correspondence with Austrian writer/critic Helmut Ploebst, Bertha Bermudez Pascual examines her past as a classical dancer and her experiences of working with Emio Greco | PC and William Forsythe. Ploebst and Bermudez Pascual question each other on the position of the dancer, choreographer and spectator, and on the transitory character of dance: the notion of where dance remains once the performance has ended.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Conjunto di NERO 01/13
Conjunto di NERO 01/13
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: ICK Amsterdam, Emio Greco | PC (regie en concept) / Erik Lint (video)
ICK Amsterdam, Emio Greco | PC (direction and concept) / Erik Lint (video)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: UvA
moderne dans
contemporary dance
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Licht is een integraal element van iedere voorstelling. InÂ Conjunto di NERO, komen dansers, belichting en ruimte samen en scheppen een constant veranderende wereld, waar nu eens dans het licht voorstuwt en dan weer het licht de richting van de dansers bepaalt. Licht en donker wisselen elkaar af en scheiden het tastbare van het ontastbare, beweging van stilstand.Licht is een integraal element van iedere voorstelling. Licht wordt niet alleen gebruikt om een atmosfeer te creÃ«ren, maar is een bron van invloed op het lichaam in veranderende landschappen die openbaren of juist verbergen. InÂ Conjunto di NERO, komen dansers, belichting en ruimte samen en scheppen een constant veranderende wereld, waar nu eens dans het licht voorstuwt en dan weer het licht de richting van de dansers bepaalt. Licht en donker wisselen elkaar af en scheiden het tastbare van het ontastbare, beweging van stilstand. De versnellende dynamiek van de voorstelling vindt zijn climax in de lichamen van de dansers. De confrontatie met hun fysieke grenzen dwingt hen de zoektocht naar harmonie op te geven. De eenzame gestalte van Emio Greco blijft achter om de volgende stap te overwegen.

Lighting is an integral element of each performance. It is used to create an atmosphere and change the landscape as well as to reveal and to hide. In Conjunto di NERO the dancers, lighting and space come together creating an ever-changing world where the dance drives the light and the light drives the dance. Brightness and darkness alternate, separating the tangible from the intangible, movement from stillness.Lighting is an integral element of each performance. It is used to create an atmosphere and change the landscape as well as to reveal and to hide. In Conjunto di NERO the dancers, lighting and space come together creating an ever-changing world where the dance drives the light and the light drives the dance. Brightness and darkness alternate, separating the tangible from the intangible, movement from stillness. The accelerating dynamics of the piece culminates with the dancers being confronted by their physical limitations and choosing to abandon their quest for harmony. The lone figure of Emio Greco is left behind to consider the next move.
oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: Greco, Emio (choreografie, licht, scenografie, geluidsconcept, uitvoerende)
Scholten, Pieter C. (choreografie, licht, scenografie, geluidsconcept)

Licht en donker wisselen elkaar af en scheiden het tastbare van het ontastbare, beweging van stilstand.Licht is een integraal element van iedere voorstelling. Licht wordt niet alleen gebruikt om een atmosfeer te creÃ«ren, maar is een bron van invloed op het lichaam in veranderende landschappen die openbaren of juist verbergen. InÂ Conjunto di NERO, komen dansers, belichting en ruimte samen en scheppen een constant veranderende wereld, waar nu eens dans het licht voorstuwt en dan weer het licht de richting van de dansers bepaalt. Licht en donker wisselen elkaar af en scheiden het tastbare van het ontastbare, beweging van stilstand. De versnellende dynamiek van de voorstelling vindt zijn climax in de lichamen van de dansers. De confrontatie met hun fysieke grenzen dwingt hen de zoektocht naar harmonie op te geven. De eenzame gestalte van Emio Greco blijft achter om de volgende stap te overwegen.

Lighting is an integral element of each performance. It is used to create an atmosphere and change the landscape as well as to reveal and to hide. In Conjunto di NERO the dancers, lighting and space come together creating an ever-changing world where the dance drives the light and the light drives the dance. Brightness and darkness alternate, separating the tangible from the intangible, movement from stillness.Lighting is an integral element of each performance. It is used to create an atmosphere and change the landscape as well as to reveal and to hide. In Conjunto di NERO the dancers, lighting and space come together creating an ever-changing world where the dance drives the light and the light drives the dance. Brightness and darkness alternate, separating the tangible from the intangible, movement from stillness. The accelerating dynamics of the piece culminates with the dancers being confronted by their physical limitations and choosing to abandon their quest for harmony. The lone figure of Emio Greco is left behind to consider the next move.
oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: Greco, Emio (choreografie, licht, scenografie, geluidsconcept, uitvoerende)
Scholten, Pieter C. (choreografie, licht, scenografie, geluidsconcept)
